headline.print_headline: Risks in Using Social Posts to Spot Signs of Distress
headline.main: Risks in Using Social Media to Spot Signs of Mental Distress

lead_paragraph: The ill-fated introduction in Britain of an app to detect predictors of suicide shows what may happen when social media posts are scrutinized for cues about a person’s mental health.
abstract: British suicide-prevention group The Samaritans face backlash with web application that alerts users to Twitter postings that contain phrases that signal mental distress, and later disable app; critics say analyzing social media activity for signs of mental health conditions amounts to quackery; researchers and psychologists who are studying issue say they will proceed as cautiously and transparently as possible with developing such diagnostic tools.
